name: cajeput

[ U ] (also cajeput oil, cajuput oil) an oil with a strong smell taken from the leaves of the cajeput tree, used in medical treatments, for example for sore skin or muscles: Cajeput can be useful with healing and soothing psoriasis. The traditional medicine stalls sell cajeput oil to cure bad stomachs.
[ C or U ] a tree that is a type of myrtle (= a tree found in Asia and Australia), from which an oil used in medical treatments is obtained: In June and November the cajeput flowers and the place turns into creamy-white wonderland. The cajeput forests provide shelter for birds and animals.
